Sharing actions cross windows
---------------
*Cross-window communication via redux action*

React.js usually is utilized to build SPA(single page application) webpages / stack of views mobile app.
However desktop app usually calls for multi-windows features, even more usually,
these windows need communicate with each other, which make developing Desktop app via SPA tricky.

Therefore, a out-of-box solution is provided to allow different windows belonging to the same SPA application
share certain Redux Actions if needed. Since this feature is provided by [redux-openfin], as you can tell by the name,
we need redux and `ReactOpenfinMiddleware` to consume this feature.

### Big Pic: Deploy diagram
![ReduxOpenfinDeployDiagram](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)

[redux-openfin] implement the interface to connect to the event bus transparent to application developers.
All developers needed to do is to list the action names wanna to share and send it to `InitializeReactOpenfin`.
After that [redux-openfin] will be responsible to send or receive the actions whose name match any one of the action names listed.

### Specify the actions in the InitializeReactOpenfin


[src/reduxs/sharedActions.ts](https://github.com/openfin-js-app/openfin-react-starter/blob/master/src/reduxs/sharedActions.ts)
```typescript
import {
    CLIENT_SET_VALUE,
} from './client/actions';

const sharedActions:string[]=[
    CLIENT_SET_VALUE,
];

export default sharedActions;
```

[src/index.tsx](https://github.com/openfin-js-app/openfin-react-starter/blob/master/src/index.tsx)
```typescript
import * as React from 'react';
import * as ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
import { InitializeReactOpenfin, ReactOpenfin } from 'react-openfin';

import sharedActions from './reduxs/sharedActions'

import i18n from './i18n';
import hist from './utils/history';

import App from './App';
 
 declare const window:any;
 
 InitializeReactOpenfin({
     fin:window.fin,
     finUuid: process.env.REACT_APP_FIN_UUID,
     sharedActions,
     i18n,
     hist
 });

```

### Identify sender or receiver

[Openfin] Rvm wll inject appUUID as `window.name` in the main window,
and the window name specified in the creating config into the other children window's `window.name`. 

```typescript
function* someGeneratorFun(action){

    if (window.name === process.env.REACT_APP_FIN_UUID){
        // main window receives this shared action    
    }else if (window.name === 'some-other-window-name'){
        // some other window receives this shared action    
    }
}

yield takeEvery('SOME_SHARED_ACTION_NAME',someGeneratorFun);
```

Meanwhile, when it broadcasts the shared actions, [redux-openfin] will populate sender's `window.name`. 
Therefore, we can use it to identify the sender. 

```typescript
import { SHARED_ACTION_ORIGIN_TAG } from 'redux-openfin/channel';

function* someGeneratorFun(action){

    // seized the sender's window.name
    const ORIGIN_TAG = action[SHARED_ACTION_ORIGIN_TAG];

    if ( ORIGIN_TAG === window[SHARED_ACTION_ORIGIN_TAG]){
        // current window sent this action    
    }else if ( ORIGIN_TAG === 'some-other-window-name'){
        // some other window sent this action
        // and ORIGIN_TAG is its window name which actually is the uuid specified during creating the window 
    }
}

yield takeEvery('SOME_SHARED_ACTION_NAME',someGeneratorFun);

```

[Openfin]: https://openfin.co/
[redux-openfin]:https://www.npmjs.com/package/redux-openfin
